title: Aaux Pro VS Freight
content:
I am currently replacing the current typeface for a publication that was previously using “Swiss” for the body copy. We would like to have a Humanist sans family that is large like Aaux Pro [http://www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MzE5](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021024153/http:/www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MzE5 "http://www.typetrust.com/fonts/font.php?id=MzE5") The reason why we are not using Aaux Pro is because our sister magazine is now using it. I did find Joshua Darden’s font Freight Sans to be quite nice as well [http://www.joshuadarden.com/shop/freightsans.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021024153/http:/www.joshuadarden.com/shop/freightsans.php "http://www.joshuadarden.com/shop/freightsans.php") it just needs the H&JS to be loosend up a bit. If you could give me your opinion on these two that would be fantastic. and if you have any suggestions of other fonts that would be much appreciated.  
The fonts I was previously looking at were:  
Alber  
Corisande  
Depot  
Flama  
FF Meta  
FF Scala Sans  
lisboa  
Mundo Sans  
Vista Sans  
Whitney
author: koop

comments.content: Aaux has a problem with tiny counters in the heavy weights. It looks like there was some corners cut in the extrapolation process. For more info, read about the [improved Apex](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021024153/http:/vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/Example+About/), which might not be a bad alternative itself.
